column4: I've always wondered if there were things the gimp did well that photoshop did not.
I have not encountered a single one.
Then again, I'm a pro in either of them to the slightest, and never utilize advanced features.

I think for basic image manipulation (cropping, rotating, resizing, maybe a few basic filters... as someone else mentioned previously) then the GIMP is sufficient.  krita has a much friendly UI, but those who have used GIMP for 3+ years might shrug it off.
